title.narrative: Promoting thriving livelihoods in Herat Province, Afghanistan through integrated fig drying, process

description.narrative: - Delivering comprehensive training to farmers in fig growing, cultivation, drying and production. Training will take place in each of the targeted villages. All farmers will receive regular on-site technical support. - Distributing fig saplings and fertiliser to each farmer to increase the quantity and quality of their crops. - Purchase one fig drying and processing machine. Selected community members will be trained in using and maintaining. A maintenance agreement will be done to ensure that the machines are well-maintained and the famers collectively share the cost of running and maintaining the machines. - Establishing producer groups to ensure farmers works collaboratively. These groups will receive business and administration, and financial and market training. - Supporting the marketing of the dried fig products, through business support and training, market linkage and the provision of packaging and labelling materials. REFLCT is going to be part of project activities specially for women. REFLCT methods will be used for awareness generation for women right and human right, Hygiene issues in order to improve awareness, so that they can think of raising demand to appropriate authorities .

This project is expected to transform the livelihoods of 400 farmers. Drying and packaging the figs will enable farmers to store their produce and sell all year round, thereby increasing their overall profit. Organising the farmers to work collaboratively will also ensure that they have a greater voice in the market, better able to negotiate a fair price.
